rules: Rule1: The team uses a drone or the team uses a camera trap.
Rule2: The team monitors plant species, or it is not the case that the project has funding.
Rule3: The team monitors animal species or the team does not monitor plant species.
Rule4: Whenever a plant species is essential to the ecosystem, the team does not monitor animal species.
Rule5: Under the condition that the project employs a botanist, the project employs an ecologist.
Rule6: Provided that the project employs an ecologist, the ecologist is an expert.
Rule7: If the ecologist follows guidelines, then under the condition that the project employs an ecologist, art conservation does not have funding.
Rule8: Provided that the team requests an extension, then if the project is not successful, the project is halted.
Rule9: If the team uses a camera trap, then the project is successful.
Rule10: Provided that the team appeals the decision, then whenever the project is not successful, the project is halted.
Rule11: Under the condition that the team submits a report, the team requests an extension.
Rule12: The team submits a report or the team lodges a complaint.
Rule13: Provided that the team lodges a complaint, the team provides evidence.
Rule14: Under the condition that the team provides evidence, the team contacts the media.
Rule15: Provided that the team contacts the media, the team appeals the decision.
Rule16: If authorization is granted for a plant survey, then the team does not violate protocol.
Rule17: Provided that authorization is granted for an animal survey, the team does not violate protocol.
Rule18: Whenever the artwork is fragile, the artwork is valuable.
Rule19: Under the condition that the project lacks funding, the project does not have funding.
Rule20: Provided that the project loses funding, the project does not have funding.
Rule21: If the team reports a shortfall, then the project lacks funding.
Rule22: The team reports a shortfall or the team warns of closure.
Rule23: Whenever the botanist is an expert, art conservation does not have funding.
Rule24: Provided that the ecologist is an expert, the botanist is an expert.
Rule25: If the director mandates a review, then under the condition that it is not the case that if the project is not successful then the project is halted, the project continues.
Rule26: The team is approved for a plant survey or the team is approved for an animal survey.
Rule27: Whenever the team is approved for an animal survey, the team does not violate protocol.
Rule28: Under the condition that the tool damages the artwork, the tool restores the artwork.
Rule29: If the conservator is authorized for an intervention, then under the condition that the tool damages the artwork, the tool does not restore the artwork.
Rule30: Whenever it is not the case that if the team uses a drone then the project is successful, the team violates protocol.
Rule31: Provided that it is not the case that authorization is granted for a plant survey or authorization is granted for an animal survey, authorization is denied for all surveys.
Rule32: Under the condition that it is not the case that authorization is granted for a plant survey or authorization is granted for an animal survey, authorization is not denied for all surveys.
Rule33: If it is not the case that if the team warns of closure then the project loses funding, then the agency overrides the closure.
Rule34: Provided that it is not the case that if the team is approved for a plant survey then the team does not violate protocol, the team is pending review.

Rule35: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the team is approved for a plant survey then the team does not violate protocol, then the team is not pending review, the artwork is fragile.

Rule36: Under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the team is approved for a plant survey then the team does not violate protocol, then the team is not pending review, the tool damages the artwork.
Rule37: Provided that the project is not successful, the project has funding.
Rule38: Under the condition that the project is not successful, art conservation has funding.
Rule39: Provided that the project is not successful, the project is not halted.
facts: Fact1: The plant species is essential to the ecosystem.
Fact2: The project employs a botanist.
Fact4: The director mandates a review.
Fact5: The conservator is authorized for an intervention.
Fact6: The artwork is not valuable.
Fact7: The agency does not override the closure.
Fact8: The project does not continue.
